author: Laura Kusisto
title: Some Cities Get Aggressive in Public-Housing Battle
text:
As New York struggles to save its public housing, other major cities have moved aggressively to transform their public-housing stock.
San Francisco is in the process of transferring essentially all of its 6,000 units to private management. The city is investing more than $800 million of its own fundsâ€”a number that for New York would be in...
